preface: A long time ago, in a galaxy far far away, I graduated from Franklin High School in 2014, unsure of what I wanted to do. Nothing really interested me in class, or engaged me in a way that made me think, "hey, this is something I really want to do when I grow up!". That all changed when I attended college at the University of Washington and took my first intro programming course.
about: I fell in love with programming immediately. I loved being able to create programs that do cool things, and I loved building projects from scratch. However, I felt like I didn't know much, and the subject is vast and ever growing. Over summer of my freshman year, I took the initiative to learn more programming. I studied web development and mobile development for hours everyday and it fueled my passion even more. In that very moment, I knew I wanted a career as a Software Developer.
education: I studied at the University of Washington and graduated with a degree in Informatics in June, 2019. My focus was mainly on software development and design. Some of those courses included full stack web development, mobile development, and design thinking.
alaskaExperience: Used Xamarin to develop and maintain cross-platform mobile applications
Worked on a machine learning project to predict flight availability
Developed and maintained REST APIs in C# with the .NET Core framework
Used ASP .NET and SQL Server to provide a platform for employees to schedule and manage tech support appointments
activities: When I'm not busy working, I'll most likely be at home playing video games. Some favorites that come to mind are the Assassin's Creed series and The Elder Scrolls Online. If I'm not glued to the screen, I'll either be outside skateboarding or reading a fantasy book.

av.desc: Discord bot written in Node.js leveraging the Discord.js API. This bot mainly manages a server for the Elder Scrolls Online game.

bp.desc: Blood Pact is the website to my INFO 2019 capstone project. The project revolves around building communities for blood donations. This was developed in React.

bp_server.desc: This is the server that is used by the Blood Pact website. It is an API written in Node and Express, an utilizes Firebase.

planc.desc: This is the iOS app for my final project in my Swift class. Plan C is an Uber for X service where X = condoms. This app was written in Swift and utilizes Firebase and Google Maps.

linkedqueue.desc: This is an earlier project of mine. It's a LinkedList implementation of a Queue data structure and offers many methods. This was written in Java.

memesquad.desc: This was the final project for my Digital Geographies class. We used Mapbox to map out shootings in the US in 2018. We used Python to access the Twitter API to find the locations of people tweeting about guns and cross-referenced them.

labyrinth.desc: This was my very first Android app that I created. This is a choose-your-own adventure story that resolves around the protagonist (you) trying to make their way out. This app features scary music and a dark story setting.

common_cents.desc: This is the Android app for my final project in Android develoment. This app  makes splitting and managing costs between people much, much easier.

thanos_snap.desc: This is a website that lets you upload an image and then performs a Thanos dusting effect (getting snapped) on it This was based off a Red Stapler tutorial.
